@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@

+package io.quarkus.kubernetes.deployment;
+
+import java.util.Optional;
+
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigGroup;
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigItem;
+
+@ConfigGroup
+public class HostAliasConfig {
+
+    /**
+     * The ip address
+     *
+     * @return The ip.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    Optional<String> ip;
+
+    /**
+     * The hostnames (comma separated) to resolve to the ip
+     *
+     * @return The path.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    Optional<String> hostnames;

@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@

+package io.quarkus.kubernetes.deployment;
+
+import java.util.Optional;
+
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigGroup;
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigItem;
+
+@ConfigGroup
+public class HostAliasConfig {
+
+    /**
+     * The ip address
+     *
+     * @return The ip.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    Optional<String> ip;
+
+    /**
+     * The hostnames (comma separated) to resolve to the ip
+     *
+     * @return The path.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    Optional<String> hostnames;

nodes.bodyText: Small nitpick: you don't need to mention comma separated anymore

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -441,6 +441,42 @@ quarkus.kubernetes.readiness-probe.initial-delay=20s
 quarkus.kubernetes.readiness-probe.period=45s
 ----
 
+=== Add hostAliases
+To add entries to a Pod's `/etc/hosts` file (more information can be found in https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/add-entries-to-pod-etc-hosts-with-host-aliases/[Kubernetes documentation]), just apply the following configuration:
+
+[source]
+----
+quarkus.kubernetes.host-aliases."10.0.0.0".hostnames=foo.com
+----
+
+This would generate the following section in the deployment descriptor:
+
+[source,yaml]
+----
+hostAliases:
+- hostnames:
+  - foo.com
+  ip: 10.0.0.0
+----
+
+To define multiple hostnames for the same ip address, just provide a list of hostnames separated by a comma (`,`):

I renamed quarkus config name to match it, it was indeed misleading here ;-)

nodes.bodyText:
Ok I understand.
What I wanted to show here in the doc is actually an excerpt of the generated kubernetes.yaml file.
Is more clear like this :

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            hostAliases:
          
          
            
            This would generate the following `hostAliases` section in the `deployment` definition:
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            [source,yaml]
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            kind: Deployment
          
          
            
            spec:
          
          
            
              template:
          
          
            
                spec:
          
          
            
                  hostAliases:
          
          
            
                  - hostnames:
          
          
            
                    - foo.com
          
          
            
                    - bar.org
          
          
            
                    ip: 10.0.0.0
          
          
            
            ----

+=== Add hostAliases
+To add entries to a Pod's `/etc/hosts` file (more information can be found in https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/add-entries-to-pod-etc-hosts-with-host-aliases/[Kubernetes documentation]), just apply the following configuration:
+
+[source]
+----
+quarkus.kubernetes.host-aliases."10.0.0.0".hostnames=foo.com
+----
+
+This would generate the following section in the deployment descriptor:
+
+[source,yaml]
+----
+hostAliases:
